RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the occupants: Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Campos, and others

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: reference in a legal case, involved in a comparison of passenger conduct where behavior was less suspicious than in the current case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who conducted the stop of Garcia's truck, applied the multi-factorial test to determine reasonable suspicion, observed suspicious behavior from occupants, used flashlight to observe vehicle occupants at night, testified about occupants' attempts to hide from the flashlight, had specialized training as border patrol agents, stopped the vehicle more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border, knew of recent smuggling activities in the area, claimed expertise to distinguish between characteristics of travelers who are illegal aliens and those lawfully present
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Ca: Individuals present in the vehicle stopped by agents Pruszenski and Baron, exhibited suspicious behavior when approached by border patrol agents, appeared unwashed and unkempt, tried to hide from agent's flashlight, reacted to a bright light at night, were in a vehicle with a heavily loaded camper shell, scrambled around trying to get lower than the windows to avoid being seen
